title: Miso Soup - How to Make Miso Soup Recipe
description: This miso soup is easy to make in just 15 minutes with dashi stock, miso paste, silken tofu, and green onions for a deliciously savory appetizer.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Global Cuisines Asian Japanese Soups and Stews Miso Soup 4.7 (510) 370 Reviews 68 Photos This miso soup is full of savory flavors. Add more dashi to your soup if you want a stronger stock. You can use yellow, white, or red miso paste for this soup — yellow miso is sweet and creamy, red miso is stronger and saltier. By Allrecipes Member Updated on October 2, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 68 68 68 68 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 4 cups water 2 teaspoons dashi granules 3 tablespoons miso paste 1 (8 ounce) package silken tofu, diced 2 green onions, sliced diagonally into 1/2 inch pieces Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine water and dashi granules in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat; bring to a boil. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Reduce heat to medium and whisk in miso paste. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in tofu. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Separate the layers of green onions, and add them to the soup. Simmer gently for 2 to 3 minutes before serving. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Recipe Tips Dashi is a basic stock used in Japanese cooking which is made by boiling dried kelp (seaweed) and dried bonito (fish). Instant dashi granules are sold in conveniently sized jars or packets and vary in strength. Learn how to cook rice to serve alongside miso soup! I Made It Print 950 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Miso Soup 01 of 68 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 68 Photo by  Steven Bulin 02/11/2025 A keeper! Easy to follow Worth the effort I used a dashi packet. It has kelp and whole dried fish in it. I also added some mushrooms. The onion isn't onion, and I forget the name of it - it's like a small leek, but more tender. 03 of 68 Photo by  Paige Taylor 02/04/2024 This recipe is so easy and it is so delicious! I used lower sodium miso and added a few fresh ginger slices for more flavor. Some people say that miso soup sodium is bad for you but do your research. Scientists have determined Miso soup does not raise blood pressure or have negative effects on people with heart conditions. It’s actually good for you. 04 of 68 Photo by  Stephanie Alves 05/04/2021 05 of 68 Photo by  Tim 04/20/2021 06 of 68 Photo by  Cjc 02/28/2021 07 of 68 Photo by  Krista Sizelove Fliegel 02/12/2021 08 of 68 Photo by  Krista Sizelove Fliegel 02/12/2021 09 of 68 Photo by  Cooking Daddy 01/27/2021 10 of 68 Photo by  Jim 01/16/2021 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Vegan Japanese Winter Squash and Leek Soup 7 Ratings Broiled Mochi with Nori Seaweed 11 Ratings Fish Sinigang (Tilapia) - Filipino Sour Broth Dish 31 Ratings Mediterranean Fish Soup 55 Ratings Creamy Italian White Bean Soup 372 Ratings Cinnamon-Curry Tuna Salad 93 Ratings Easy Chickpea Soup 69 Ratings Ukha (Russian Fish Soup) 38 Ratings 12 Miso Soup Recipes That Are Full of Flavor Easy Chinese Corn Soup 101 Ratings Lomi Lomi Salmon 43 Ratings Manhattan Clam Chowder 29 Ratings Seafood Cioppino 222 Ratings Avocado and Tuna Tapas 295 Ratings Tuna Salad With Fresh Dill 122 Ratings Zesty Tuna Salad 157 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
